name: Then She Was Gone: A Novel

title: Gone
content: So many emotions one goes through reading this book. A nice family with all the dynamics of life.  Emily a typical teenager with a bright future is taken by an unstable woman.  The author explains perfectly what all go through and why some do what they do.

title: wonderful
content: Laurel experiences the unthinkable: her fourteen-year-old child goes missing. Not just her child — it is THE child, the one she favors over her three children. Ellie goes to school one day and never comes back. She’s there one moment, and then she’s gone. Ellie is a smart, carefree girl with a crush on a guy who shares her passion for academics and good grades, so she’s no runaway. The years go by, and just when the police give up, Laurel gets some rather devastating news...
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2020

title: Verified Purchase
content: The years pass. Laurel trudges through her days, picking up the pieces of her broken life. She tries to make amends with her daughter Hannah and her son Jake, but they’re all grown now, with their own lives to worry about. Her marriage is long over, her ex now in a steady and loving relationship with a pleasant lady. Laurel's life couldn't be worse if she tried...
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2024

title: The perfect beach holiday pick! Harrowing and riveting from beginning to end!
content: And then she meets Floyd. It’s a chance encounter, a semi meet-cute at a café. He tells her about his books — academic books about math — and about his #1 fan: his nine-year-old daughter, Poppy. Hope flares for Laurel. Will she find happiness with Floyd? And then she meets his daughter — and it’s like taking a trip to the past. Poppy is almost the splitting image of Ellie. Laurel is floored. How is it possible? This is only the beginning though. She’s opened a Pandora’s Box of disturbing revelations that even she wouldn’t have been able to imagine.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I’m not a fan of child abduction thrillers, but THEN SHE WAS GONE is one harrowing and amazing read! I couldn’t put it down. This book was on my TBR pile for over a year. I took it with me for my French Polynesian holiday because, why not? I’m so glad I did. The sea-salt breeze, the hammock, the sunset, this book — sweet memories are made of this! I took three books with me, and this one practically read itself. The writing is amazing, well crafted and riveting, with no over the top twists for shock value. Everything serves a purpose in this book. Many of us will guess the outcome, but that’s beside the point. There are so many surprises — so many “mini twists” — that you’ll love it for the character-driven piece of brilliant suspense that it is. The psychological aspects are amazing. There’s a character with Borderline Personality Disorder in this book, and the author touches on various subjects, like triangulation and toxic enmeshments. It’s all done in an organic, not-in-your-face way, which makes it more appealing. I’ve always loved Lisa Jewell, have loved her since her early “chick lit” days. I’m glad she now gets to write the genre she loves.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2024

title: perfect state
content: Downsides? Just one. Floyd is a socially awkward mathematician, but he says “Brangelina” at one point. I can’t picture a man — let alone a middle-aged one — saying something like this. I’m surprised the editor didn’t pick up on it. Other than that, I love this novel. One of my favorites this year. Five solid Pecan and Toffee iced lattes, with extra vanilla-flavored oat milk!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: it’s in perfect state, no scratches or anything, so grateful!!

title: What an Emotional Rollercoaster!
content: LOVED this book!  This is the first book I read by Lisa Jewell and it did not disappoint! From the epilogue I was hooked! I loved reading from different character POVs but I know it’s not for everyone but I enjoy jumping around. The only thing I suppose I wish was different is just a bit more pov from certain characters. But I can’t wait to jump to another Lisa Jewell book!

title: Verified Purchase
content: Much of the book takes place in 2015, and is told from the point of view of Laurel Mack, the missing girl's mother.  Ellie was Laurel's youngest daughter.  Ellie's remains have finally been found, so maybe the family can now have some closure.  Not that the family unit is still intact. Laurel was so filled with grief over the last ten years  that she had nothing left of herself for her husband or her other children.  Now Laurel is divorced, and is estranged from her older daughter and son.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2024

title: Then  She was  Gone
content: Ten years after her teenage daughter disappears, a woman crosses paths with a charming single father whose young child feels eerily familiar, in this evocative, suspenseful drama from New York Times bestselling author Lisa Jewell—perfect for fans of Paula Hawkins and Liane Moriarty.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2017

title: Verified Purchase
content: Ellie Mack was the perfect daughter. She was fifteen, the youngest of three. She was beloved by her parents, friends, and teachers. She and her boyfriend made a teenaged golden couple. She was days away from an idyllic post-exams summer vacation, with her whole life ahead of her.

content: And then she was gone.

title: Verified Purchase
content: Now, her mother Laurel Mack is trying to put her life back together. It’s been ten years since her daughter disappeared, seven years since her marriage ended, and only months since the last clue in Ellie’s case was unearthed. So when she meets an unexpectedly charming man in a café, no one is more surprised than Laurel at how quickly their flirtation develops into something deeper. Before she knows it, she’s meeting Floyd’s daughters—and his youngest, Poppy, takes Laurel’s breath away.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2024

title: Amazing!
content: The story will take a grip on you from the very first pages. Constantly as you read you will asking yourself what's happening? What can possible happen next? And you'll be surprised, startled, mystified or confused. The author did a masterful job of tying up all of the threads at the end. It was a bit dark, but nonetheless a brilliant plot.

title: don’t give up half way through
content: The writing is terrific, though at times it's a little confusing to figure whose point of view the chapter is in, and the time shifts are distracting as well. I didn't find Laurel that nice or interesting. She lets her family fall apart after Ellie disappears. Surely Hanna and Jack picked up on how much she favored "golden Ellie." She seems very self-absorbed and not very kind.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: No one seems to go to work regularly. Floyd is an enigmatic figure who claims his mother was "14 when he was born"? What relevance does that have to the story? None, it's a red herring. Laurel does find information about him when she googles him. He is too good to be true and their relationship advances too quickly. Laurel hops into bed with him and meets his family too quickly for someone of her negative and closed up personality. Poppy is not cute but rather bratty and annoying.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2024

title: Just as described !!! Fast Shipping
content: Without giving away too much, the red flags about Noelle are waving often and early. Though I didn't quite expect her to do what she did, I wasn't surprised. She is pure evil and how she accomplishes what she does is not fully explained.  The not-too-subtle clues are dropped conspicuously.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2024

title: Verified Purchase

title: Book
content: I really liked this book! I am sitting here writing this with tears in my eyes, because the ending in the epilogue, I was hoping for that, and I’m glad Lisa gave it to us readers. As a mom this was a hard book to read, because it literally is a nightmare for me as a mom, your daughter who you love, suddenly disappears and there is no trace of her. For years, they tell you that she has probably run away, but you know that couldn’t be the case, there is something wrong. Years and years go by and as the rest of the world and your family move on, even your husband, but you still have a missing piece of your heart, questions left unanswered. I felt all the feelings that Laurel was having. Then when you least expect it, a man enters your life, with a beautiful daughter, and everything changes.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024

content: This one really gets to you. Touches you in places that bring out all of the feelings under the sun; happiness, sadness, dread, wonder…. I loved it. Absolutely loved it. Read it in less than 2 days!!
